page.title: 11Recreation in Sedlescombe
page.content: In the 1970's all the Sports Clubs in the village were amalgamated under the title 'The Sedlescombe Sports Association'.They then acquired a sports field known as the Pestalozzi Field at the southern end of the village and erected a pavilion which is well used by the associate clubs, viz., the Football, Stoolball, Cricket and Junior Football Clubs. The Tennis Club has courts which can be hired by the public, and a pavilion. The School has a small swimming pool which can be hired by local clubs. There are two children's playgrounds, one near the tennis courts and one near a housing development. Many people are keen gardeners. There are fishing facilities at Powdermill Reservoir and game shooting on Hurst Estate. Small farms organise clay pigeon shoots.
